member.name: P:Fake.Core.Arguments.ToWindowsCommandLine
member.summary: This is the reverse of https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/17w5ykft.aspx

member.name: P:Fake.Core.Arguments.ToStartInfo
member.summary: Create a new command line string which can be used in a ProcessStartInfo object. If given, returns the exact input of `OfWindowsCommandLine` otherwise `ToWindowsCommandLine` (with some special code for `mono`) is used.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.Arguments.ToLinuxShellCommandLine
member.summary: Escape the given argument list according to a unix shell (bash)

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Arguments.OfWindowsCommandLine(System.String)
member.summary: See https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/17w5ykft.aspx

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Arguments.OfStartInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new arguments object from a given startinfo-conforming-escaped command line string. Same as `OfWindowsCommandLine`.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Arguments.OfArgs(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Create a new arguments object from the given list of arguments

member.name: T:Fake.Core.Arguments
member.summary: Represents a list of arguments

member.name: T:Fake.Core.RawCreateProcess
member.summary: A raw (untyped) way to start a process

member.name: T:Fake.Core.StreamSpecification.CreatePipe
member.summary: Retrieve the raw pipe from the process (the StreamRef is set with a stream you can write into for 'stdin' and read from for 'stdout' and 'stderr')

member.name: T:Fake.Core.StreamSpecification.UseStream
member.summary: Redirect to the given stream (the stream must be provided by the user and be writeable for 'stdout' & 'stderr' and readable for 'stdin')

member.name: T:Fake.Core.StreamSpecification.Inherit
member.summary: Do not redirect, or use normal process inheritance

member.name: T:Fake.Core.StreamSpecification
member.summary: Various options to redirect streams.

member.name: T:Fake.Core.DataRef`1
member.summary: Represents basically an "out" parameter, allows to retrieve a value after a certain point in time. Used to retrieve "pipes"

member.name: T:Fake.Core.Command.RawCommand
member.summary: Windows: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/bb776391(v=vs.85).aspx Linux(mono): https://github.com/mono/mono/blob/0bcbe39b148bb498742fc68416f8293ccd350fb6/eglib/src/gshell.c#L32-L104 (because we need to create a commandline string internally which need to go through that code) Linux(netcore): See https://github.com/fsharp/FAKE/pull/1281/commits/285e585ec459ac7b89ca4897d1323c5a5b7e4558 and https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/master/src/System.Diagnostics.Process/src/System/Diagnostics/Process.Unix.cs#L443-L522

member.name: T:Fake.Core.Command
member.summary: The type of command to execute

member.name: T:Fake.Core.StartedProcessInfo
member.summary: Some information regaring the started process

member.name: T:Fake.Core.CreateProcess`1
member.summary: Handle for creating a process and returning potential results.

member.name: T:Fake.Core.ProcessOutput
member.summary: The output of the process. If ordering between stdout and stderr is important you need to use streams.

member.name: T:Fake.Core.IProcessHook`1
member.summary: Hook for events when an CreateProcess is executed.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Shell.Exec(System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.String},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.String})
member.summary:
Runs the given process, waits for it's completion and returns the exit code. ## Parameters
- `cmd` - The command which should be run in elavated context. - `args` - The process arguments (optional). - `directory` - The working directory (optional).

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Shell.AsyncExec(System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.String},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.String})
member.summary:
Runs the given process asynchronously. ## Parameters
- `cmd` - The command which should be run in elavated context. - `args` - The process arguments (optional). - `directory` - The working directory (optional).

member.name: T:Fake.Core.Shell
member.summary: Allows to exec shell operations synchronously and asynchronously.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ExecParams.Args
member.summary: Command-line argument pairs. The value will be quoted if it contains a string, and the result will be appended to the CommandLine property. If the key ends in a letter or number, a space will be inserted between the key and the value.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ExecParams.CommandLine
member.summary: Command-line parameters in a string.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ExecParams.WorkingDir
member.summary: The working directory for the program. Defaults to "".

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ExecParams.Program
member.summary: The path to the executable, without arguments.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ExecParams.Empty
member.summary: Default parameters for process execution.

member.name: T:Fake.Core.ExecParams
member.summary: Parameter type for process execution.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo.WorkingDirectory
member.summary: When UseShellExecute is true, the fully qualified name of the directory that contains the process to be started. When the UseShellExecute property is false, the working directory for the process to be started. The default is an empty string ("").

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo.Verb
member.summary: The action to take with the file that the process opens. The default is an empty string (""), which signifies no action.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo.UseShellExecute
member.summary: true if the shell should be used when starting the process; false if the process should be created directly from the executable file. The default is true.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo.UserName
member.summary: The user name to use when starting the process. If you use the UPN format, user@DNS_domain_name, the Domain property must be null.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo.StandardOutputEncoding
member.summary: An object that represents the preferred encoding for standard output. The default is null.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo.StandardErrorEncoding
member.summary: An object that represents the preferred encoding for error output. The default is null.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo.RedirectStandardOutput
member.summary: true if output should be written to Process.StandardOutput; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo.RedirectStandardInput
member.summary: true if input should be read from Process.StandardInput; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo.RedirectStandardError
member.summary: true if error output should be written to Process.StandardError; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo.WindowStyle
member.summary: One of the enumeration values that indicates whether the process is started in a window that is maximized, minimized, normal (neither maximized nor minimized), or not visible. The default is Normal.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the user password in clear text to use when starting the process.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo.LoadUserProfile
member.summary: true if the Windows user profile should be loaded; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo.FileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the application or document to start.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo.ErrorDialogParentHandle
member.summary: Gets or sets the window handle to use when an error dialog box is shown for a process that cannot be started.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo.ErrorDialog
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether an error dialog box is displayed to the user if the process cannot be started.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo.Environment
member.summary: Gets the environment variables that apply to this process and its child processes. NOTE: Recommendation is to not use this Field, but instead use the helper function in the Proc module (for example Process.setEnvironmentVariable) NOTE: This field is ignored when UseShellExecute is true.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo.Domain
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that identifies the domain to use when starting the process. If this value is null, the UserName property must be specified in UPN format.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo.CreateNoWindow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to start the process in a new window.

member.name: P:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo.Arguments
member.summary: Gets or sets the set of command-line arguments to use when starting the application.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo.WithEnvironment(Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpMap{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Sets the current environment variables.

member.name: T:Fake.Core.ProcessResult
member.summary: A process result including error code, message log and errors.

member.name: T:Fake.Core.ConsoleMessage
member.summary: A record type which captures console messages

member.summary: Behaves like AwaitObservable, but calls the specified guarding function after a subscriber is registered with the observable.

member.summary: Convert the arguments instance to a string list

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ArgumentsModule.appendNotEmpty(System.String,System.String,Fake.Core.Arguments)
member.summary: Append an argument prefixed by another if the value is not null or empty

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ArgumentsModule.appendIf(System.Boolean,System.String,Fake.Core.Arguments)
member.summary: Append an argument to a command line if a condition is true.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ArgumentsModule.appendOption(System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.String},Fake.Core.Arguments)
member.summary: Append an argument prefixed by another if the value is Some.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ArgumentsModule.appendRawEscapedNotEmpty(System.String,System.String,Fake.Core.Arguments)
member.summary: Append an argument prefixed by another if the value is Some. This method is only required if you NEED quotes WITHIN your argument (some old Microsoft Tools). "raw" methods are not compatible with non-raw methods.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ArgumentsModule.appendRawEscapedOption(System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.String},Fake.Core.Arguments)
member.summary: Append an argument prefixed by another if the value is Some. This method is only required if you NEED quotes WITHIN your argument (some old Microsoft Tools). "raw" methods are not compatible with non-raw methods.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ArgumentsModule.appendRawEscapedIf(System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,Fake.Core.Arguments)
member.summary: Append an argument prefixed by another if the value is Some. This method is only required if you NEED quotes WITHIN your argument (some old Microsoft Tools). "raw" methods are not compatible with non-raw methods.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ArgumentsModule.appendRawEscaped(System.String,System.String,Fake.Core.Arguments)
member.summary: Appends the given raw argument to the command line, you can not use other methods for this to work This allows unusal quoting with the given prefix, like /k:"myarg" ("/k:" would be the argPrefix) This method is only required if you NEED quotes WITHIN your argument (some old Microsoft Tools). "raw" methods are not compatible with non-raw methods.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ArgumentsModule.appendRaw(System.String,Fake.Core.Arguments)
member.summary: Appends the given raw argument to the command line, you can not use other methods for this to work This method is only required if you NEED quotes WITHIN your argument (some old Microsoft Tools). "raw" methods are not compatible with non-raw methods.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ArgumentsModule.append(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},Fake.Core.Arguments)
member.summary: Append all arguments after the current arguments

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ArgumentsModule.withPrefix(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},Fake.Core.Arguments)
member.summary: Append the given arguments before all current arguments

member.summary: Create a new command line string which can be used in a ProcessStartInfo object. If given, returns the exact input of `OfWindowsCommandLine` otherwise `ToWindowsCommandLine` (with some special code for `mono`) is used.

member.summary: Escape the given argument list according to a unix shell (bash)

member.summary: Escape the given argument list according to a unix shell (bash)

member.name: T:Fake.Core.Args
member.summary: Helper functions for proper command line parsing

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcessUtils.findLocalTool(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Like tryFindLocalTool but returns the `tool` string if nothing is found (will probably error later, but this function is OK to be used for fake default values.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcessUtils.tryFindLocalTool(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Find a local tool in the given envar the given directories, the current directory or PATH (in this order) Recommended usage `tryFindLocalTool "TOOL" "tool" [ "." ]`

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcessUtils.walkDirectories(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Walks directories via breadth first search (BFS)

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcessUtils.findPath(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Tries to find the tool via Env-Var. If no path has the right tool we are trying the PATH system variable. Considers PATHEXT on Windows. [omit]

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcessUtils.tryFindPath(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Tries to find the tool via given directories. If no path has the right tool we are trying the current directory and the PATH system variable. Considers PATHEXT on Windows.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcessUtils.tryFindTool(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Tries to find the tool via Env-Var. If no path has the right tool we are trying the PATH system variable. Considers PATHEXT on Windows.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcessUtils.tryFindFileOnPath(System.String)
member.summary: Searches the current directory and the directories within the PATH environment variable for the given file. If successful returns the full path to the file. Considers PATHEXT on Windows. ## Parameters - `file` - The file to locate

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcessUtils.findFilesOnPath(System.String)
member.summary: Searches the current directory and in PATH for the given file and returnes the result ordered by precendence. Considers PATHEXT on Windows.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcessUtils.findFile(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Searches the given directories for the given file, failing if not found. Considers PATHEXT on Windows.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcessUtils.tryFindFile(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Searches the given directories for all occurrences of the given file name. Considers PATHEXT on Windows.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcessUtils.findFiles(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Searches the given directories for all occurrences of the given file name, on windows PATHEXT is considered (and preferred when searching)

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcessUtils.findFilesInternal(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Searches the given directories for all occurrences of the given file name [omit]

member.name: M:Fake.Core.InternalStreams.StreamModule.duplicate``1(Fake.Core.InternalStreams.IStream{``0})
member.summary: Duplicates the given stream, which means returning two stream instances which will read the same data. At the same time buffers all data (ie read from s as fast as possible). Any data written to the returned instances will be written to the given instance.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.CreateProcess.interceptStream(System.IO.Stream,Fake.Core.StreamSpecification)
member.summary: intercept the given StreamSpecification and writes the intercepted data into target. Throws if the stream is not redirected (ie is Inherit).

member.name: M:Fake.Core.CreateProcess.ofStartInfo(System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo)
member.summary: Create a CreateProcess from the given `ProcessStartInfo`

member.name: M:Fake.Core.CreateProcess.fromRawCommand(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary:
Create a CreateProcess from the given file and arguments
### Example
CreateProcess.fromRawCommand "cmd" [ "/C"; "echo test" ] |> Proc.run |> ignore

member.name: M:Fake.Core.CreateProcess.fromRawWindowsCommandLine(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create a CreateProcess from the given file and arguments

member.name: M:Fake.Core.CreateProcess.fromRawCommandLine(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Create a CreateProcess from the given file and arguments
### Example
CreateProcess.fromRawCommandLine "cmd" "/C \"echo test\"" |> Proc.run |> ignore
### Using BlackFox.CommandLine
See [`BlackFox.CommandLine`](https://github.com/vbfox/FoxSharp/tree/master/src/BlackFox.CommandLine) for details
open BlackFox.CommandLine
CmdLine.empty |> CmdLine.append "build" |> CmdLine.appendIf noRestore "--no-restore" |> CmdLine.appendPrefixIfSome "--framework" framework |> CmdLine.appendPrefixf "--configuration" "%A" configuration |> CmdLine.toString |> CreateProcess.fromRawCommandLine "dotnet.exe" |> Proc.run |> ignore

member.name: M:Fake.Core.CreateProcess.fromCommand(Fake.Core.Command)
member.summary:
Create a simple `CreateProcess<_>` instance from the given command.
### Example
Command.RawCommand("file", Arguments.OfArgs ["arg1"; "arg2"]) |> CreateProcess.fromCommand |> Proc.run |> ignore

member.name: T:Fake.Core.CreateProcess
member.summary:
Module for creating and modifying CreateProcess<'TRes> instances. You can manage:
- The command (ie file to execute and arguments) - The working directory - The process environment - Stream redirection and pipes - Timeout for the process to exit - The result and the result transformations (`map`, `mapResult`)
More extensions can be found in the [CreateProcess Extensions](apidocs/v5/fake-core-createprocessext-createprocess.html)
### Example
Command.RawCommand("file", Arguments.OfArgs ["arg1"; "arg2"]) |> CreateProcess.fromCommand |> Proc.run |> ignore

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Proc.run``1(Fake.Core.CreateProcess{``0})
member.summary: Like `start` but waits for the result synchronously.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Proc.startAndAwait``1(Fake.Core.CreateProcess{``0})
member.summary: Convenience method when you immediatly want to await the result of 'start', just note that when used incorrectly this might lead to race conditions (ie if you use StartAsTask and access reference cells in CreateProcess after that returns)

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Proc.start``1(Fake.Core.CreateProcess{``0})
member.summary: Starts the given process and waits for the `Result` task. (see `startRaw` documentation). In most common scenarios the `Result` includes the `Raw` task or the exit-code one way or another.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Proc.startRawSync``1(Fake.Core.CreateProcess{``0})
member.summary: Similar to `startRaw` but waits until the process has been started.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Proc.startRaw``1(Fake.Core.CreateProcess{``0})
member.summary:
Starts a process. The process has been started successfully after the returned task has been completed. After the task has been completed you retrieve two other tasks: - One `Raw`-Task to indicate when the process exited (and return the exit-code for example) - One `Result`-Task for the final result object.
Note: The `Result` task might finish while the `Raw` task is still running, this enables you to work with the result object before the process has exited. For example consider a long running process where you are only interested in the first couple of output lines

member.name: T:Fake.Core.Proc
member.summary:
Module to start or run processes, used in combination with the `CreateProcess` API.
### Example
#r "paket: nuget Fake.Core.Process //" open Fake.Core CreateProcess.fromRawCommand "./folder/mytool.exe" ["arg1"; "arg2"] |> Proc.run |> ignore

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithWorkingDirectory(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,System.String)
member.summary: When UseShellExecute is true, the fully qualified name of the directory that contains the process to be started. When the UseShellExecute property is false, the working directory for the process to be started. The default is an empty string ("").

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithVerb(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,System.String)
member.summary: The action to take with the file that the process opens. The default is an empty string (""), which signifies no action.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithUseShellExecute(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: true if the shell should be used when starting the process; false if the process should be created directly from the executable file. The default is true.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithUserName(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,System.String)
member.summary: The user name to use when starting the process. If you use the UPN format, user@DNS_domain_name, the Domain property must be null.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithStandardOutputEncoding(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: An object that represents the preferred encoding for standard output. The default is null.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithStandardErrorEncoding(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: An object that represents the preferred encoding for error output. The default is null.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithRedirectStandardOutput(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: true if output should be written to Process.StandardOutput; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithRedirectStandardInput(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: true if input should be read from Process.StandardInput; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithRedirectStandardError(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: true if error output should be written to Process.StandardError; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithWindowStyle(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,System.Diagnostics.ProcessWindowStyle)
member.summary: One of the enumeration values that indicates whether the process is started in a window that is maximized, minimized, normal (neither maximized nor minimized), or not visible. The default is Normal.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithPassword(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,System.String)
member.summary: Gets or sets the user password in clear text to use when starting the process.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithLoadUserProfile(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: true if the Windows user profile should be loaded; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithFileName(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,System.String)
member.summary: Gets or sets the application or document to start.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithErrorDialogParentHandle(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Gets or sets the window handle to use when an error dialog box is shown for a process that cannot be started.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithErrorDialog(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether an error dialog box is displayed to the user if the process cannot be started.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithCurrentEnvironmentVariables(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo)
member.summary: Sets the current environment variables.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithEnvironmentVariables(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Tuple{System.String,System.String}})
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that identifies the domain to use when starting the process.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithRemovedEnvironmentVariable(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,System.String)
member.summary: Unsets the given environment variable for the given startInfo.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithEnvironmentVariable(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the given environment variable for the given startInfo.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithoutEnvironment(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo)
member.summary: Remove the current Environment Variables and use the default

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithDomain(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,System.String)
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that identifies the domain to use when starting the process.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithCreateNoWindow(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to start the process in a new window.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.ProcStartInfoExtensions.ProcStartInfo.WithArguments(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,System.String)
member.summary: Gets or sets the set of command-line arguments to use when starting the application.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Process.withFramework(Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo)
member.summary: Ensures the executable is run with the full framework. On non-windows platforms that means running the tool by invoking 'mono'.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Process.shellExec(Fake.Core.ExecParams)
member.summary: Execute an external program and return the exit code. [omit]

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Process.ensureProcessesHaveStopped(System.String,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Waits until the processes with the given name have stopped or fails after given timeout. ## Parameters - `name` - The name of the processes in question. - `timeout` - The timespan to time out after.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Process.killAllCreatedProcesses
member.summary: Kills all processes that are created by the FAKE build script unless "donotkill" flag was set.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Process.killMSBuild
member.summary: Kills the MSBuild process.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Process.killFSI
member.summary: Kills the F# Interactive (FSI) process.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Process.killAllByName(System.String)
member.summary: Kills all processes with the given name

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Process.getAllByName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns all processes with the given name

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Process.getFileName(System.Diagnostics.Process)
member.summary: Retrieve the file-path of the running executable of the given process.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Process.killById(System.Int32)
member.summary: Kills all processes with the given id

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Process.asyncShellExec(Fake.Core.ExecParams)
member.summary: Execute an external program asynchronously and return the exit code, logging output and error messages to FAKE output. You can compose the result with Async.Parallel to run multiple external programs at once, but be sure that none of them depend on the output of another.

member.summary: Runs the given process, waits for its completion and returns if it succeeded.

member.summary: Starts the given process and returns immediatly.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Process.execElevated(System.String,System.String,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
Runs the given process in an elevated context and returns the exit code. ## Parameters
- `cmd` - The command which should be run in elavated context. - `args` - The process arguments. - `timeOut` - The timeout for the process.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Process.execSimple(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo},System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
Runs the given process and returns the exit code. ## Parameters
- `configProcessStartInfoF` - A function which overwrites the default ProcessStartInfo. - `timeOut` - The timeout for the process. ## Sample
let result = Process.execSimple (fun info -> info.FileName <- "c:/MyProc.exe" info.WorkingDirectory <- "c:/workingDirectory" info.Arguments <- "-v") (TimeSpan.FromMinutes 5.0)
if result <> 0 then failwithf "MyProc.exe returned with a non-zero exit code"

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Process.execWithResult(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo},System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
Runs the given process and returns the process result. ## Parameters
- `configProcessStartInfoF` - A function which overwrites the default ProcessStartInfo. - `timeOut` - The timeout for the process.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.Process.execRaw(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo,Fake.Core.ProcStartInfo},System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit})
member.summary:
Runs the given process and returns the exit code. ## Parameters
- `configProcessStartInfoF` - A function which overwrites the default ProcessStartInfo. - `timeOut` - The timeout for the process. - `silent` - If this flag is set then the process output is redirected to the given output functions `errorF` and `messageF`. - `errorF` - A function which will be called with the error log. - `messageF` - A function which will be called with the message log.
Sets all current environment variables to their current values
Sets the given environment variables.
Unsets the given environment variable for the started process
Sets the given environment variable for the given startInfo. Existing values will be overriden.

member.summary: [omit]

member.name: P:Fake.Core.Process.AlwaysSetProcessEncoding
member.summary: If set to true the ProcessHelper will start all processes with a custom ProcessEncoding. If set to false (default) only mono processes will be changed.

member.name: M:Fake.Core.CreateProcessExt.CreateProcess.withFramework``1(Fake.Core.CreateProcess{``0})
member.summary:
Ensures the executable is run with the full framework. On non-windows platforms that means running the tool by invoking 'mono'.
### Example
Command.RawCommand("file.exe", Arguments.OfArgs ["arg1"; "arg2"]) |> CreateProcess.fromCommand |> CreateProcess.withFramework // start with mono if needed. |> Proc.run |> ignore

member.name: T:Fake.Core.CreateProcessExt.CreateProcess
member.summary: Extensions to [`CreateProcess`](apidocs/v5/fake-core-createprocess.html).

member.name: T:Fake.Core.CreateProcessExt
member.summary: Some extensions for the `CreateProcess` module, opened automatically (use add `open Fake.Core`)
